I only encountered only a couple of glitches throughout my entire play through\, a texture on a ceiling vent was flickering and the other was Ellie’s backpack had a mind of its own for a few seconds when starting one of the later levels.Game play: Yes it’s a little dated compared other faster playing games and the controls feel sometimes clunky just like the original\, but it wasn’t broken then and isn’t now. Knowing that that your character is likely to sometimes stall at an obstacle and can’t wall jump\, back-flip or negotiate the chapters like a professional free runner adds to the thrill of the combat in the sometimes claustrophobic environments.Music Voice Acting and Sound effects : Are all fantastic and you can feel the emotion and effort put in by the actors.Story: I Loved it in the end! This game took me on a roller coaster  of emotions\, I felt happy\, sad\, angry\, shocked and at certain points numb in a complete state of disbelief. I love complex characters and the main characters choices in this story can seem wrong or not what you would expect. Once I finished it I sat back and went over their points of view I came to the conclusion that what I thought I wanted out of this sequels story wasn’t what I got but it did everything a good story does and that doesn’t make it a bad one!… Expand
